summary: This is a Law360 newsletter email from August 27, 2019, containing summaries of various legal news articles. It includes a brief mention of the law firm Epstein Becker Green in a firm listing and a reference to an article by attorneys from Epstein Becker on clawback provisions for employee incentive pay. The document is not a primary case document but a legal industry news digest.

persons.name: Andrew Cuomo
persons.context: Mentioned as signing a bill extending the statute of limitations for Martin Act financial fraud suits to six years.

persons.name: Letitia James
persons.context: Announced a $1.2 million settlement with dollar stores for selling expired products.

persons.name: Richard Lee
persons.context: Mentioned as having an insider trading trial scheduled for December 9.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.context: Mentioned as receiving a May 19 trial date in a California embezzlement case.

persons.name: Harvey Weinstein
persons.context: Mentioned as pleading not guilty to a new indictment and having his criminal trial delayed until January 2020.

persons.name: Sam Edelman
persons.context: Mentioned as challenging New York's taxation of intangible income for dual residents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Ruzal
persons.context: Co-author of an expert analysis article on clawback provisions for employee incentive pay, listed in the newsletter.

persons.name: Carly Baratt
persons.context: Co-author of an expert analysis article on clawback provisions for employee incentive pay, listed in the newsletter.

persons.name: Lawrence Spiegel
persons.context: Testified that Gregory Craig defied calls to register as a foreign agent for work for the Ukrainian government.

persons.name: Gregory Craig
persons.context: Mentioned as having defied calls to register as a foreign agent for work for the Ukrainian government, according to testimony.

persons.name: Greg Abbott
persons.context: Appointed a former judge and Vinson & Elkins attorney to the Texas Supreme Court.

persons.name: Lucy Fato
persons.context: Featured in an interview about her role at AIG.

connections.description: Co-authors of an expert analysis article on clawback provisions for employee incentive pay for the law firm Epstein Becker Green.
Former colleagues at Skadden law firm; Spiegel testified about Craig's actions regarding foreign agent registration.

events.title: Cuomo Signs Martin Act Extension
events.description: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo signed a bill extending the statute of limitations for Martin Act financial fraud suits from three to six years.

events.title: Dollar Stores Settlement
events.description: Dollar General, Family Dollar, and Dollar Tree agreed to pay $1.2 million in fines for selling expired drugs and useless motor oil, announced by NY AG Letitia James.

events.title: Richard Lee Insider Trading Trial
events.description: Trial date set for former SAC Capital portfolio manager Richard Lee on insider trading charges.

events.title: Harvey Weinstein Trial Delay
events.description: Criminal trial of Harvey Weinstein on predatory sexual assault charges delayed until January 2020 after he pled not guilty to a new indictment.

events.title: State AGs Challenge Migrant Detention Rule
events.description: California and 19 other state attorneys general announced a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's rule eliminating a 20-day limit on detention of immigrant children.

keyFacts: The document is a Law360 legal news digest from August 27, 2019, not a primary Epstein case document.

The law firm 'Epstein Becker Green' is listed among other law firms, and attorneys Jeffrey Ruzal and Carly Baratt from that firm are noted as authors of an expert analysis article on clawback provisions.
The newsletter covers a wide range of unrelated legal news, including actions by NY AG Letitia James, the Harvey Weinstein case, and a challenge to Trump administration immigration rules.
There is no substantive information about Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or his case within this document's content.
